meanings.definition: In a way that causes surprise or astonishment.
meanings.sent1: The magician's trick worked surprisingly well, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent2: She surprisingly found her lost keys in the first place she looked.
meanings.sent3: The cat surprisingly jumped out of the box, startling everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The news of the unexpected snowstorm caught everyone by surprise, surprisingly covering the town in white.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display was surprisingly beautiful, lighting up the night sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: To a degree exceeding what is expected or anticipated.
meanings.sent1: He surprisingly finished the race in record time, surpassing all expectations.
meanings.sent2: The team surprisingly won the championship, shocking their opponents.
meanings.sent3: The cake surprisingly rose perfectly in the oven, exceeding the baker's hopes.
meanings.sent4: Her voice surprisingly filled the entire hall, reaching every corner with its power.
meanings.sent5: The plant surprisingly grew taller than the fence, exceeding its usual height.
